description: This course presents the fundamental principles of exercise testing and prescription for both healthy and special needs individuals. Students explore techniques for assessing fitness and prescribing exercise using a variety of ergometers for improvement of health fitness parameters. Students also utilize case studies and laboratory experiences. Topics include health/medical histories, submaximal graded exercise testing, and assessment of strength, flexibility, pulmonary functions, and body composition. Offered annually. Prerequisites: senior kinesiology major; BIO 143, BIO 243 and KINES 375.
name: Exercise Prescription
notes: This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
